title: Brazil 1-1 Senegal REPORT: Roberto Firmino on target but Sadio Mane wins penalty to earn draw
text:
Liverpool strikers Roberto Firmino and Sadio Mane were in the thick of the action in Singapore as Brazil and Senegal played out a draw.

The two nations met for the first time in footballing action in an international friendly that marked Neymar's 100th appearance for Brazil.

Brazil got themselves into an early lead when Firmino scored a delicious chip over Alfred Gomis to put his side in front.

Philippe Coutinho had curled a pass out to Gabriel Jesus on the right flank, before the Man City man cut inside to play Firmino through.

Firmino was wide of the target and at an acute angle but was able to lift the ball over Gomis from close range.

(Image: REUTERS)

Superstar Neymar produced plenty of showboating as he combined with Philippe Coutinho, but neither could find the crucial final ball.

Brazil looked to be taking a slender lead into the break until Mane was bundled over in the box for a penalty.

Mane had collected the ball on the left wing before setting off towards goal.

He left Dani Alves trailing before darting inside Marquinhos whose clumsy foul conceded the penalty.

(Image: REUTERS)

Famara Diedhiou cooly slotted home the spot kick past Ederson to make it all square at half-time.

Chances were few and far between in the second half, with Neymar missing the crossbar from a free-kick.

Salif Sane came closest for Senegal when his long-range strike had Ederson at full stretch, but the Man City stopper held well.

Neymar then had two more bites of the cherry either side of a Richarlison effort, but neither could score as the sides settled for a draw.
description: Roberto Firmino scored an exquisite chip to put Brazil ahead before Sadio Mane won Senegal a penalty to level
